apiDocs.title: API Documentation
apiDocs.subtitle: Developer resources for integrating with AfriTrace
apiDocs.overviewDesc: The AfriTrace API provides programmatic access to mineral certificate verification, traceability data, and compliance information. Our RESTful API uses JSON for data exchange and supports both authentication-based and public endpoints.
apiDocs.authDesc: API requests require authentication using API keys. Generate your API key from your dashboard settings.
apiDocs.verifyDesc: Verify a mineral certificate by batch code
apiDocs.getBatchDesc: Retrieve detailed information about a specific mineral batch
apiDocs.rateLimitDesc: API requests are limited to 1000 requests per hour per API key
apiDocs.supportDesc: For technical assistance, contact our developer support team

dataStandards.remaDesc: Rwanda Environment Management Authority certification requirements
dataStandards.blockchainDesc: How we use blockchain technology to ensure data integrity
dataStandards.dataFormatDesc: Technical specifications for certificate data structures and API responses

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.introductionText: AfriTrace is committed to protecting your privacy and ensuring the security of your personal information. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your data when you use our mineral traceability platform.
privacy.personalInfoDesc: When you create an account, we collect your name, email address, and organization details.
privacy.usageDataDesc: We automatically collect information about how you interact with our platform, including IP addresses, browser type, and pages visited.
privacy.certificateDataDesc: When you verify or upload certificates, we store the batch codes, mineral types, and verification results.
privacy.provideServices: To provide and maintain our services
privacy.improveExperience: To improve user experience and platform functionality
privacy.communicate: To communicate with you about updates and support
privacy.comply: To comply with legal obligations and prevent fraud
privacy.dataSharingDesc: We do not sell your personal information. We may share data with:
privacy.regulatoryBodies: Regulatory bodies (REMA, ICGLR) for compliance verification
privacy.serviceFathers: Service providers who assist in platform operations
privacy.legalRequirements: When required by law or to protect our rights
privacy.dataSecurityDesc: We implement industry-standard security measures including encryption, secure servers, and regular security audits to protect your information.
privacy.cookiesDesc: We use cookies and similar technologies to enhance user experience, analyze usage patterns, and maintain session security.
privacy.dataRetentionDesc: We retain your information for as long as your account is active or as needed to provide services, comply with legal obligations, and resolve disputes.
privacy.childrenPrivacyDesc: Our platform is not intended for children under 13 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children.
privacy.policyChangesDesc: We may update this Privacy Policy periodically. Continued use of the platform after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.
privacy.address: Address: Kigali, Rwanda - KN 4 Ave, Nyarugenge

terms.title: Terms of Use
terms.acceptanceDesc: By accessing or using AfriTrace, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Use and all applicable laws and regulations. If you do not agree with any of these terms, you are prohibited from using the platform.
terms.serviceDescriptionText: AfriTrace provides a digital platform for mineral certificate verification and traceability. Our services include blockchain-verified certificate authentication, compliance checking with REMA and ICGLR standards, and supply chain transparency tools.
terms.accountResponsibilitiesDesc: You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials and for all activities that occur under your account. You must:
terms.provideAccurate: Provide accurate and complete registration information
terms.notifyChanges: Notify us immediately of any unauthorized use
terms.notShare: Not share your account with others
terms.eligibilityDesc: You must be at least 18 years old and have the legal capacity to enter into binding contracts to use AfriTrace.
terms.acceptableUseDesc: You may use AfriTrace only for lawful purposes and in accordance with these Terms. Prohibited uses include:
terms.dataAccuracyDesc: While we strive for accuracy, certificate verification is provided 'as is' and should be independently verified for critical business decisions
terms.thirdPartyDataDesc: AfriTrace relies on data from REMA, ICGLR, and mining cooperatives. We are not responsible for errors in source data
terms.updatesDesc: Certification status may change. Users should verify current status for time-sensitive transactions
terms.intellectualPropertyDesc: All content, trademarks, and intellectual property on the AfriTrace platform are owned by AfriTrace or our licensors. You may not reproduce, distribute, or create derivative works without our express written permission. User-submitted content remains your property, but you grant us a license to use it for platform operations.
terms.reverseEngineering: Reverse engineering or attempting to extract source code
terms.interfere: Interfering with or disrupting platform services
terms.scraping: Scraping, harvesting, or mining data without authorization
terms.maliciousCode: Uploading malicious code, viruses, or harmful content
terms.liabilityDesc: AfriTrace is provided 'as is' without warranties of any kind. We are not liable for indirect, incidental, or consequential damages. Our total liability shall not exceed the amount you paid for using our services in the past 12 months.
terms.terminationDesc: We reserve the right to suspend or terminate your account for violation of these terms, fraudulent activity, or at our discretion with notice. Upon termination, your right to use the platform ceases immediately.
terms.governingLawDesc: These terms are governed by the laws of the Republic of Rwanda. Any disputes shall be resolved through arbitration in Kigali, Rwanda, under the rules of the Kigali International Arbitration Centre.
terms.termsChangesDesc: We may modify these terms at any time. Continued use of the platform after changes constitutes acceptance of the modified terms.
terms.contactInfoDesc: For questions about these Terms of Use:
terms.address: Address: Kigali, Rwanda - KN 4 Ave, Nyarugenge
